Text:
She wants to practice something with Cid Kageno—that'd
be you—so I've decided to loan my little brother to her
willingly.

I've got a secret mission for you...direct from Iris
Midgar.
A secret mission?

She wants to practice something with Cid Kageno—that'd
be you—so I've decided to loan my little brother to
her willingly.
Uh...nobody mentioned this to me.
Well, yeah. That's why I'm telling you now.
Urrg... Do I have the right to say no?

Of course not, you big silly. I'm not sure what the
princess wants with you, but I'm sure it's a big
honor, whatever it is!

This paper has the day, time, and place you're
supposed to go. Burn it after you've memorized it. 
Got it?
Um... Got it?!
Yes, ma'am...
She wants to "practice" with me, eh...

But why did she ask me to meet up with her at
Mitsugoshi's international trade area?
Sorry I'm late...
Well, Cid...what do you think?

I had Alexia choose the design for me. And the
president of Mitsugoshi personally brought
a catalogue and some samples for me.

I could have had it delivered to the castle, but I
decided to come here personally, since it's such
a special order.

I thought that if I were dressed like this, I could
blend in with the other citizens of the capital,
making it ideal for inspections and so I—
Wait a minute...are you nervous?
Huh?
You're, um, speaking really fast.
Well...I'm a little nervous.

I don't normally wear clothing with this much
frontal-exposure...so I'm still not used to it.

I asked you to come along with me so I wouldn't feel
as nervous...but I suppose that didn't work.
Um...why me?
Huh? Didn't Claire tell you?

Only that she was "loaning" me to you to "practice"
something. Though now that I'm here, it's obvious
we're not practicing anything.

O-Oh, so you didn't know. I'd just assumed you'd come
here knowing fully what this was about—

Cid, I was asking you to be my companion
around town for the day.
Be your companion...

Whoa, whoa, slow down! There's no way I can handle
such an important job!
Now, now, you needn't be so tense.

Not only am I wearing unfamiliar clothing and
footwear, but—and I'm ashamed to admit this—
I am unfamiliar with the act of walking down
the street with a companion...

There is a small list of people I am comfortable with
seeing this side of myself. As my little sister's
friend and Claire's little brother, you are the only
one I can trust, Cid.
Uh. No, I totally can't... Uh, wait a minute—

Sorry to intrude on you both. I am Luna, from
Mitsugoshi's apparel division.
Uh, okay.

Here, Princess Iris, this is the day's inspection
plan.

So Mitsugoshi was in the royal inspection plan! Looks
like we're finally taking a purveyor stance...or
we're just going full-Evil Merchant Echigoya mode...

It is only natural that we would give those who buy
our products a lovely day-tour of our establishment.

Thank you for choosing Mitsugoshi. We look forward to
your continued business.

Iris looks over the plan, then hands it to Cid— which
he reads over and then nods in agreement.

Okay, now this makes sense. It makes sense, but...why
wasn't I consulted while these plans were made?

Do you...disapprove? If that is so...then, I'm afraid
I shall have to report to Claire that you—

Yes, Princess! As you wish, Princess! I would love to
be your companion for the day!

Well! That is good to hear. Well, I look forward to
your excellent companionship.

Why is it that whenever you're in the shadows...a big
ray of light always has to come shining in?
Is something the matter?
Huh?
You've been awfully quiet.

If anything, I'm worried about you, Cid. I keep
worrying that I pushed this all upon you and you
didn't really want to be my companion today.

Is that so? Well, your expression was a bit tense, so
I was wondering if I was bothering you.

You don't need to worry about me. This is a hundred
times better than getting my ear yelled off by my
sister later.
Heehee! You two sure are close.
Uh, no...

And...well, there is another reason why I've seemed
a bit tense.

It's these high-heeled shoes. I'm just not used to
walking in them. I can balance in them all right, at
least—probably thanks to my sword training—but I
can't seem to walk gracefully in them.

Ordinarily, I only wear high-heeled shoes for
national ceremonies...

Okay, now I get it... Well, let's slow down a bit,
then.
Thank you. That's very kind.

In the square just a little bit ahead...is that where
that Mitsugoshi-run ice cream parlor is?
Yes, and I've heard rave reviews about it.

Now that you mention it, I have noticed more people
around us have ice cream.
But...I am a little surprised.
Surprised? By what?

Well, even though there's a lot of people around us,
not one of them seems to have recognized me.

Maybe it's because you're giving off a completely
different vibe than usual?
Ah, that makes sense...

Yes, I do feel rather like I've become a different
person. This just might be one of the best things
about fashion.

Is that what you'd call, an extraordinary feeling for
royalty?
Extraordinary...yes, it is just that.

Mitsugoshi's ice cream parlor...that's it over there,
yes? I see a long line—it must be very popular.

Oh! I'll go get in line. You can wait there on that
bench, Princess Iris.
Huh?Huh?! Oh, but I couldn't. I will queue with you.
Please, don't tire yourself out.

(Could it be...that he's noticed my high-heeled shoes
have made me tired?)
Well, I'll be right back. Please save us some seats.
U-Understood!

Iris, now all alone, sat on a bench and waited
distractedly for Cid to return.

(Even though there's such a lively crowd around me...
somehow, I'm able to remain at peace inside.)

(I feel like in this moment...I am just an ordinary
girl.)

(Is this why Alexia dresses up and walks around town
incognito like this? To have this extraordinary
feeling?)

(Perhaps this is what Alexia was trying to show me... 
Or, perhaps she wished I knew about it?)

(A princess becoming a nobody is just such a new
feeling to me...and it's fun. I feel a little tense,
but in a good way. So this is what it feels like to
truly relax.)

As Iris reflects on this, Cid returns to her with
ice creams in both hands.
I'm back, Princess.
Thank you very much.
Oh, right! Here's your ice cream.

As Iris took her ice cream from Cid, he stared at her
with a curious look in his eyes.
What is it?
Huh? Oh, it's nothing...you just look...refreshed?

Iris giggled at Cid's quizzical expression. But Cid
prodded no further. He sat next to Iris and began to
eat his ice cream.

(I think the reason why my sister encouraged me to
wear new clothes is very clear. She did it to make my
life better.)

(Wait a minute! If that's the case, then that
means...)

That Thong Alexia gave me...was I supposed to wear
that here, too?
Pfft?!

Wh-Wh-Why are you talking about that now?! Wait, no! 
Why are you talking about that to me?!

Cid? You're awfully sweaty—what's wrong? How can you
be so flushed, when the ice cream is so cold?

Whoa, whoa, whoa! Come on, it's a perfectly natural
reaction to have to what you just said!

Iris gave him a curious look...then she tucked her
long hair behind her ears and happily brought her
lips to her ice cream cone, as if she were kissing
it.
